jobDescription: nuTonomy aims to be the first company in the world to launch an autonomous taxi system, and we are building up an awesome team to make this goal a reality. We are developing the first-of-its-kind complete solution for providing point-to-point mobility via large fleets of autonomous vehicles. This includes software for autonomous vehicles, smartphone-based ride hailing, fleet management, and teleoperation. The company's software has been tested extensively on public roads in the U.S. and Singapore. We offer a unique opportunity to work closely with experts from a wide array of backgrounds, to create ground-breaking technology with potential for huge impact. As a member of a fast-growing start-up, you will be able to make a large contribution to the final product. For more information about nuTonomy, visit: www.nutonomy.comWe are seeking a highly talented Machine Learning Research Scientist in Santa Monica, CA to support a variety of teams and projects, including the following:Develop an active learning feedback loop for our DL / ML systemsMine driving logs for anomalies & corner casesPerform meta analysis of log data to identify problem areas and improvement opportunitiesDevelop metrics to quantify component and system level performanceThings youll work on: Design machine learning algorithms from scratchTranslate generated algorithms into production-level codeDefine system documentation, metrics, measurementsCollaborate with various teams to achieve objectives in improving the system with more dataEducation and Skills youll likely have:In-depth understanding of common Machine Learning and Deep Learning algorithms (e.g., for classification, regression and clustering)Practical experience in data science, statistics, and analysis of large data setsFluency in in a modern programming language, such as C++ and/or Python (and their related data processing, Machine Learning, and visualization libraries)MA in Computer Science or similar preferredBonus points (but not required):Experience using data modeling toolsFamiliarity with autonomous robotics and vehicle systems
